description.en: Elementary biostatistics: introduction to probability and properties of diagnostic tests, basic principles of  data presentation and analysis. Main epidemiologic indicators and their uses. The role of statistics in medical research. Types and basic design issues of epidemiologic studies and clinical trials.
description.et: Biostatistika alused: tõenäosus ja diagnostiliste testide omaduste uurimine, andmete esitamise ja analüüsi üldpõhimõtted. Epidemioloogilised näitajad, nende leidmine ja kasutusalad. Statistika roll meditsiinialastes teadusuuringutes. Epidemioloogilised uuringud, nende tüübid ja korraldamise üldpõhimõtted, kliinilised katsed.

objectives.en: To obtain elementary knowledge in the field of epidemiology and biostatistics needed for a medical practicioner.
objectives.et: Praktiseeriva arsti jaoks vajalike elementaarsete teadmiste omandamine epidemioloogia ja biostatistika valdkonnast

learning_outcomes.en: After the completion of the course, student:
- can calculate and describe health indicators in populations,
learning_outcomes.et: - oskab arvutada ja kirjeldada tervisenäitajaid rahvastikurühmas,

learning_outcomes.en: - knows population health indicators databases and can use them,
learning_outcomes.et: - teab ja oskab kasutada rahvastiku  tervisenäitajate andmebaase,

learning_outcomes.en: - is able to critically assess the results of studies.

independent_work.et: Research project and written homework. All instructions given in the practicals. Preparation for team-based learning sessions.

grade_preconditions.et:
In total, practical team-based learning (TBL) sessions will count for 40% of the final grade. During each TBL session, students will have the opportunity to earn up to 5 points that will count toward their final grade. It is mandatory for all students to participate in the practical sessions and come prepared for the practicals. Attendance, participation, and contribution to the team will be taken into consideration when awarding points. In order to foster a collaborative and supportive learning environment, students will be assigned to teams by the lecturer at the beginning of the course. These teams will remain fixed throughout the duration of the course.

There is no opportunity to improve points earned from team-based learning sessions, except in cases where a student is absent due to illness or other extenuating circumstances and provides a doctor's note within one week to be eligible for additional questions on the final test to make up for the missed TBL session.

Students must earn at least half of the points available on the final test, homework and project (50% in each).  


Participation at least in 14 practical sessions, for each missed practical beyond that will reduce the total amount of points by  -2 points.

grade_evaluation.et: Two tests 40% (in total), team-based learning sessions 40%, project 20%, adjustment for practical attendance
